title: Château de Gaudou 2017 Terroirs Châtelet de Gaudou Malbec-Merlot (Côtes du Lot)
description: In a departure for this estate, the Durou family has gone outside Cahors to produce an entry-level wine. Plenty of ripe, juicy Malbec gives this wine attractive acidity as well as red-berry flavors. Fruity and open, the wine will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Companhia das Quintas 2016 Barão de Figueira Siria (Beira Interior)
description: From high-altitude vineyards, this is a crisp, cool wine. Made from the Siria grape that thrives in this climate, the wine is fruity with a creamy texture and good acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: J.J. Vincent 2015  Bourgogne
description: Using purchased grapes, the Vincent family of Château de Fuissé has expanded its interests into wines such as this. Simple and fruity, it offers a creamy texture and attractive touch of spice. It is made for early drinking, which is now.

title: Mitolo 2015 Angela Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: This is a ripe, sunshine-soaked red bursting with plush red and black berries, cracked pepper, dusting polish, mocha and earth. The oak is a little clunky and warm but big red lovers with dig this style.

title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2016 Lagoalva Vinho Tinto Red (Tejo)
description: Castelão and Touriga Nacional make a happy pair in this broad wine. The tannins of the Touriga give the wine shape, allowing plenty of structure for the red fruits of Castelão to show well. Drink this rich wine from late 2018.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2016 Reserva White (Tejo)
description: This soft wine is creamy and smooth thanks to the 35% of Chardonnay in the blend. Viognier and Arinto add perfume and some crispness. Packed with fruit, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Quinta do Pinto 2016 Vinhas do Lasso Colheita Seleccionada White (Alenquer)
description: A blend of equal amounts of Arinto and Fernão Pires, this is a smooth and creamy wine. Soft citrus and crisper acidity give the wine both its fresh character and its rounded aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Heringer Vineyard Aglianico (Yolo County)
description: This is a lean, nervy wine with firm tannins and edgy acidity backing the raspberry and cranberry flavors. It's medium bodied, lively and dry.

title: Santa Ema 2015 Barrel Select 60/40 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Maipo Valley)
description: This Cabernet-Merlot blend is soft and plump, with little to no spine. Its plum and blackberry aromas show notes of olive and herbs. Chocolaty blackberry and marshmallow flavors carry into the soft finish, with almost no bite.

title: Scotto Family Cellars 2016 Anthony & Dominic Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: An extremely dark color and pronounced oak notes in both the aroma and the flavor make this a dramatic and rather simple wine. It has a sense of sweetness, like caramel and chocolate and a rich mouthfeel.

title: Tabor 2016 Adama Chardonnay (Galilee)
description: Aromas of lemon and petrol lead the way for flavors of citrus, honeysuckle and guava that offer a sense of brightness across the entire palate, right into the soft, floral finish.

title: Talbott 2016 Kali Hart Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Reserved aromas of dark red fruit and damp soil show on the shy nose of this bottling. The flavors are also a little flat, with wet clay, red fruit and sharp acidity most prominent.

title: The Crusher 2015 Merlot (California)
description: This medium-boded oaky style of wine has baking-spice aromas and sweet-seeming flavors like blackberry jam along with moderate tannins.

title: Thorn Clarke 2015 Terra Barossa Shiraz (Barossa Valley)
description: This wine offers notes of dark berries, plums, pencil shavings and mocha, with a hint of eucalyptus. The palate is medium bodied, with plush dark fruit, grippy tannins and a dried green-herb finish.

title: Turkey Flat 2016 White (Barossa Valley)
description: The nose of this wine offers honey and sun-drenched yellow fruit—pineapples and golden apples—while the palate shows a rich, oily texture. This shows a creamy malolactic quality that clashes with green, bitter fruit while the finish falls a little flat.

title: Vie Winery 2014 Wynonna's Vineyard Syrah (Big Valley District-Lake County)
description: Earthy dusty barnyard elements blend into the dark-fruit flavors of this medium-to full-bodied wine. It has a good base of black plum and a nice sense of smoothness and maturity on the palate.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Monte de Baía Red (Península de Setúbal)
description: This ripe, soft blend is dominated by Castelão. It is lightly textured, gently tannic and full of berry fruits. With its final acidity and ripeness, it is ready to drink.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Bridão Colheita Seleccionada Trincadeira (Tejo)
description: Dense black fruits are the name of the game in this ripe wine with spice and pepper in the background. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Barão de Vilar 2015 Vinha das Magaridas Red (Douro)
description: This ripe wine is lightly structured while certainly showing the tannins and minerality of the Douro. Blackberry flavors make for a fruity wine finished with attractive acidity. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Barefoot NV Merlot (California)
description: Spicy aromas, good concentration and an off-dry flavor make this wine robust while staying rather soft and friendly for people who don't love aggressive tannins.

title: Cantine Astroni 2012 Strione Falanghina (Campania)
description: Subdued aromas suggesting brimstone, flint and a whiff of paraffin slowly emerge in the glass. The lean evolved palate evokes hints of dried yellow stone fruit and orange rind while a saline note marks the close. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit sensations.

title: Casalino 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with aromas of red plum, vanilla and baking spice. The aromas carry over to the simple palate together with round tannins.

title: Casca Wines 2016 Cascas Tinto Winemaker's Selection Red (Douro)
description: Berry flavors and soft tannins give a wine that is open and accssible. The blackberry fruit has enough tannins to give the wine its structure and firm edge while keeping the easy brightness that will develop as the wine ages. Drink from 2019.

title: D'Arenberg 2016 The Stump Jump White (McLaren Vale)
description: An unusual blend of 60% Riesling, 20% Sauvignon Blanc, with a little Marsanne and Roussanne, this wine offers bright, zippy notes of lemony and white pepper. The acidity on the palate is rather searing and is mildly balanced by some sweetness, but the sugar sticks on out the finish. Nevertheless, there's a bight, citrusy quality that is appealing.

title: Domaine d'Arton 2016 Les Hauts d'Arton White (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: A perfumed blend of Colombard, Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng, this balanced wine is immediately attractive. It has lively acidity along with bright white and citrus fruits that contrast comfortably with spicy texture at the end. Drink the wine now.

title: Domaine de Ménard 2017 Cuvée Marine White (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Blending Colombard, Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng, this wine, with its name that evokes the not-far-distant Atlantic Ocean, is fruity, ripe with green and citrus fruits and a touch of honey. It is refreshing, tangy and ready to drink.

title: Faustino Rivero Ulecia 2011 Reserva Tempranillo-Garnacha  (Rioja)
description: Rusty and translucent in the glass, this has roasted, underripe berry and road tar aromas and a raw palate. Its burnt plum flavors are underdeveloped, finishing peppery and low on fruit.

title: Fogline Vineyards 2013 Hillside Block Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy in compost, this wine is oaky, tart in acidity and slightly reduced, taking a medium-bodied approach to ripeness and rich cherry fruit.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2017 Viognier (South Coast)
description: A ripe take on an already unctuous grape, this bottling shows tuberose, lily, ripe white peach and fresh nectarine on the rich nose. The palate is also very ripe with flavors of Bosc and Anjour pear, baked apple and strong honeysuckle.

title: Hoyt Family Vineyards 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: Very shy on the nose, this bottling from the family's Malibu estate eventually offers slightly sour lemons with patience. The citrus flavors are strong on the sip as well.
